mainContentHtml:
Introduction to Pixieset for Conference Galleries

Pixieset is renowned for its elegant and user-friendly interface, making it an excellent choice for photographers aiming to build a gallery of conference images. Whether you're covering a corporate event, seminar, or symposium, a well-curated gallery can boost your portfolio and appeal to potential clients.

Uploading Images to Pixieset

To begin, you'll need to create an account on Pixieset. Once registered and logged in, navigate to the 'Collections' section. This is where you can start organizing your conference images.

  1. Create a New Collection: Click on the 'Add Collection' button. Name your collection appropriately to reflect the conference you're shooting.
  2. Set Collection Settings: You can customize your collection's settings. Choose from options like client access, password protection, and image security.
  3. Upload Images: Within the collection screen, click 'Upload Photos'. You can upload images directly from your device or drag-and-drop from your desktop. Pixieset supports a variety of image formats including JPEG, PNG, and TIFF.
  4. Organize and Customize: Once your images are uploaded, you can rearrange them, create sets, and even add descriptions or tag them for easy navigation.
  5. Publish Your Collection: After editing and organizing, you can publish your gallery. Pixieset offers a beautiful preview option to review how your gallery will appear to viewers.

Technical Tips for Uploading

  • Optimizing Image Size: Ensure your images are properly optimized for the web. Compress them to maintain quality without increasing loading times.
  • Consistent File Naming: Use consistent naming conventions like 'ConferenceName_Date_ImageNumber' to keep files organized.
  • Color Profiles: Apply sRGB profiles to ensure consistent color appearance across devices.
  • Leverage Pixieset's SEO Tools: Utilize Pixieset's built-in tools to optimize your gallery for search engines by using relevant keywords and meta descriptions.
